title: Norman Tebbit for the Daily Mail
text: Despite some brave decisions and much talk of 'The Cuts', public expenditure is rising not falling, debt is increasing and the monthly deficit this June was higher than last year. Blair's poisonous legacy to his heir Cameron was not just a financially incontinent country, but one with a submerged underclass addicted to welfare. Ill-educated, ill-disciplined, near illiterate and innumerate unemployables living in families in which no one worked, ever had worked or wanted to work and living better than the working families next door. ...read
description: Norman Tebbit for the Daily Mail Columnist Archive for MailOnline
